title: Bash Programmable Completion for Spack
body:
Closes #3003.

Do you have trouble remembering the ordering for `spack config edit compiler`? Do you have to run `spack list 'py-*'` before installing any Python package because you can't remember the spelling of `py-mysqldb1`? Don't you wish you could just tab-to-complete **everything**? Allow me to introduce _Bash Programmable Completion for Spack!_

To add tab completion, simply source `setup-env.sh` from a Bash shell. Here is an example session. In the following examples, let the cursor be denoted by brackets, i.e. `[]`, and assume that the user presses <kbd>TAB</kbd><kbd>TAB</kbd> at the cursor position:

``` bash
$ spack []
activate    cd          compilers   deactivate  doc         fetch       help        load        module      purge       restage     test        url
arch        checksum    config      debug       edit        find        info        location    patch       python      setup       uninstall   use
bootstrap   clean       configure   dependents  env         flake8      install     md5         pkg         reindex     spec        unload      versions
build       compiler    create      diy         extensions  graph       list        mirror      providers   repo        stage       unuse       view    
$ spack con[]
$ spack config []
edit  get   
$ spack config e[]
$ spack config edit []
compilers  config     mirrors    modules    packages   repos      
$ spack config edit p[]
$ spack config edit packages  # the full command
```

``` bash
$ spack in[]
info     install  
$ spack ins[]
$ spack install []
Display all 1145 possibilities? (y or n)  # lists all 1145 available packages
$ spack install py-[]
Display all 169 possibilities? (y or n)  # lists all 169 available Python packages
$ spack install py-numpy []  # whoops, forgot to add an option
$ spack install --[] py-numpy  
--clean        --fake         --jobs         --keep-stage   --log-format   --only         --verbose      
--dirty        --help         --keep-prefix  --log-file     --no-checksum  --run-tests    
$ spack install --v[] py-numpy
$ spack install --verbose[] py-numpy  # the complete command
```
This is a reboot of #459, updated to the latest Spack commands and flags. I still don't know what a couple commands are for, so I wasn't able to list options for them. Let me know if anyone sees anything that can be improved. @aprokop @pramodk @davydden @tgamblin
